title: vintage style travel poster
content:
hi. i need to design a vintage style travel poster for a major wine brand based in argentina.. any suggestions on what to use? im thinking the whole steamer trunk,vintage luggage tag, romantic travel 1930’s time period.. i want to use two faces that really compliment each other for the headline (something like “experience BRAND NAME HERE”)…

thoughts? ideas?
author: misslaloki

comments.content:
How appropriate - I’m designing a book on Vintage Ocean Liners and it has lots of samples of luggage tags, stickers and posters. One font I think works very nicely is the Neutraface and Neutraface Condensed family from House Industries. I’m using them in combination with Stuyvesant Open script and Corvinus Skyline.

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=94&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=94&subpage=viewfonts)
great, thanks! i need some change from what i was sticking to, it seemed too loopy.

If you would like to look at a few typefaces that were actually **inspired by vintage travel posters** , may I suggest a few little numbers from my catalog: [Bessie Mae Moocho](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/bessie-mae-moocho-nf/), [East Coast Frolics](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/east-coast-frolics-nf/), [Gotham Rail Company](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/gotham-rail-company-nf/), [Maloja Palace](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/maloja-palace-nf/), [Marrakesh Express](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/marrakesh-express-nf/), [Mesa Verde](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/mesa-verde-nf/), [Pomegranate](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/pomegranate-nf/), [Red Star Line](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/red-star-line-nf/) and [Zuider Zee.](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/zuider-zee-nf/)

[Eunoia](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/eunoia/) is something I did recently. It’s not based on anything in particular, but has a kind of geometric style that could be Art Deco, or Op Art, or even contemporary.

Could be mixed with something more historical, say from [Blumlein 3](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094424/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000106)
